summary: Completed comprehensive testing of Jira functionality after fixing critical React SelectItem errors. Successfully resolved major blocking issues and verified core Jira workflows are now functional.

resolved_critical_bugs.issue: SelectItem with empty string value causing React runtime errors
resolved_critical_bugs.impact: Prevented entire Kanban board from rendering, blocking all task management
resolved_critical_bugs.fix_applied: Changed SelectItem value from empty string to 'unassigned' and updated form handling

remaining_minor_issues.issue: Modal overlay blocking create task button clicks
remaining_minor_issues.impact: Create task functionality partially blocked by modal overlay
remaining_minor_issues.workaround: Task creation works, but requires force clicking

remaining_minor_issues.impact: Accessibility warnings in console, no functional impact

passed_tests: Backend APIs working perfectly (100% success rate from previous test)
Authentication system with JWT tokens - all 4 user roles login successfully
RBAC working correctly - tech user only sees TECH board, buyer only sees BUY board
Task card click functionality - edit modal opens successfully
Task editing workflow - forms populate correctly with existing data
User assignment from task cards - assignee dropdown appears and functions
Cross-team routing columns present - 'To Tech' and 'To Designers' columns visible
Kanban board rendering with all task cards visible (5 cards on BUY, 3 cards on TECH)
Board navigation between different user roles
Priority, tags, and due date display on task cards
Column structure correct for each board type (BUY: Backlog/In Progress/To Tech/To Designers/Done, TECH: Todo/In Dev/Code Review/Done)
action_item_for_E1: The critical React SelectItem error has been fixed and core Jira functionality is now working. Minor remaining issues: 1) Modal overlay blocking create task button (needs z-index or click handling fix), 2) Add aria-describedby attributes to Dialog components for accessibility. The user's reported issues are now resolved: task editing by clicking cards works, cross-team routing columns are present, user assignment from cards works, and overall Jira workflow is functional.
